title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 § 182.5 - Endangered species, threatened species and species of special concern
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 § 182.5 - Endangered species, threatened species and species of special concern

State Regulations
(a) 'Endangered
species'. Those endangered species that merit listing as endangered either
based on the criteria for listing in sections
182.3
(b) and (c)
of this Part or because they are species listed as endangered by the United

States Department of the Interior in the Code of Federal Regulations ( 50 CFR
part
17
). (see section
182.1
of this Part) and are native
to New York State include: Common Name

Scientific Name
(1) Molluscs: Dwarf wedgemussel

Prolasmidonta heterodon

Northern riffleshell

Epioblasma torulosa rangiana

Pink mucket

Lampsilis abrupta

Clubshell

Pleurobema clava

Fat pocketbook

Potamilus capax

Salamander mussel

Simpsonaias ambigua

Rayed bean

Paetulunio fabalis

Chittenango ovate amber snail

Novisuccinea chittenangoensis
(2) Insects: (i) Tomah mayfly
'Siphlonisca aerodromia'
(ii) American burying beetle
'Nicrophorus americanus'
(iii) Hessel's hairstreak
'Callophrys hesseli'
(iv) Karner blue
'Lycaeides melissa samuelis'
(v) Regal fritillary
'Speyeria idalia'
(vi) Persius duskywing
'Erynnis persius'
(vii) Grizzled skipper
'Pyrgus centaureae wyandot'

'Atrytone arogos arogos'
(ix) Bog buckmoth
'Hemileuca' species 1'
(x) Pine pinion moth
'Lithophane lepida lepida'

Acipenser brevirostrum

Atlantic sturgeon

Gilt darter

Percina evides

Northern cricket frog

Atlantic coast leopard frog

Lithobates kauffeldi
(5) Reptiles: (i) Mud turtle

'Clemmys muhlenbergii'

'Eretmochelys imbricata'

(v) Leatherback sea turtle
'Dermochelys coriacea'
(vi) Queen snake
'Regina septemvittata'

'Sistrurus catenatus'
(6) Birds: (i) Golden eagle

'Numenius borealis'

'Chlidonias niger'
(ix) Short-eared owl
'Asio flammeus'
(x) Loggerhead shrike
'Lanius ludovicianus'
(7) Mammals: Northern long-eared bat

Indiana bat

Allegheny woodrat

Neotoma magister

Sperm whale

Physeter macrocephalus

Sei whale

Balaenoptera borealis

Blue whale

Finback whale

Humpback whale

Megaptera novaeangliae

Right whale

Eubalaena glacialis

Gray wolf

Canis lupus

Cougar

Puma concolor
(b) 'Threatened species'. Those species that merit listing as threatened either
based on the criteria for listing in sections
182.3
(b) and (c)
of this Part or because they are species listed as threatened by the United

States Department of the Interior in the Code of Federal Regulations ( 50 CFR
part
17
). (see section
182.1
of this Part) and are native
to New York State include: Common Name

Scientific Name

beetle

'Cryptobranchus alleganiensis'
(ii) Marbled salamander

182.5

Adopted

New

York State Register December 4, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 49, eff. 12/4/2024

Amended

New

York State Register April 9, 2025/Volume XLVII, Issue 14, eff. 4/9/2025

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. (a) '
